yoga_questions.question: What is yoga?
responses: Yoga is an ancient practice that unites mind and body through breath, movement, and meditation.
Yoga originated in India and combines physical postures, breathing exercises, and mindfulness.
The practice of yoga helps improve flexibility, strength, and mental well-being.
Yoga is both a spiritual and physical discipline that promotes holistic health.

yoga_questions.question: What are the benefits of yoga?
responses: Yoga enhances flexibility, strength, and mental clarity.
Practicing yoga regularly can reduce stress, improve posture, and boost immunity.
Yoga helps in relaxation, improves sleep, and increases focus.
From reducing anxiety to improving heart health, yoga offers numerous physical and mental benefits.

yoga_questions.question: What is downward dog pose?
responses: Downward Dog, or Adho Mukha Svanasana, is a foundational yoga pose that stretches the entire body.
In Downward Dog, your hands and feet are on the ground as your hips lift to form an inverted V shape.
This pose strengthens the arms, legs, and back while improving circulation.
A staple of many yoga sequences, Downward Dog helps relieve tension and lengthens the spine.

yoga_questions.question: How often should I do yoga?
responses: The frequency of yoga depends on your goals, but practicing 3-5 times a week is ideal.
Even practicing yoga for 15-20 minutes daily can provide significant benefits.
Beginners can start with 2-3 sessions per week and gradually increase.
Yoga is most effective when practiced consistently, even in short sessions.

yoga_questions.question: What is the best time to do yoga?
responses: Morning yoga helps energize the body, while evening yoga aids relaxation and sleep.
Yoga can be practiced at any time of day, but doing it on an empty stomach is best.
Early morning yoga aligns with traditional practices and is great for mindfulness.
